result.execSummary:
All charges against Derek Dawin McCastle in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derek Dawin McCastle is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Criminal Damage to Property (Less Than $2,500 Damage)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek Dawin McCastle

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derek Dawin McCastle in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Derek Dawin McCastle.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Derek Dawin McCastle in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Derek Dawin McCastle.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  Parties remain in trial posture.  Any further motions will be heard on day of trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 10/26/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Received and Filed. Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions
Received and Filed. Defense Motion in Limine

Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
For reasons discussed with the parties the date and time of the next hearing has been changed. Case is now 9/30/2022 at 8:30 for Review Hearing in branch 35. Parties notified via email.

Defendant Derek Dawin McCastle in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Court orders case adjourned.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report
Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court increases bail to $500.00 CASH but STAYS increase to the next date. Court orders Justice Point Supervision reinstated.

Defendant Derek Dawin McCastle in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Discharge Report 5-13-2022, filed.  rmm
JusticePoint Services Violation Report (missed office contact), filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RME
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Derek Dawin McCastle in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Derek Dawin McCastle in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derek Dawin McCastle appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
